translated: Mañjuśrī, it is excellent, excellent, that you have thought to ask the Tathāgata about this matter.

original: legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang ngas bshad do //
analyzed: legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang ngas bshad do //
translated: Listen well and keep this in mind! I will explain it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen po de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du bdag nyid byin gyis brlabs nas sngags kyi tshig 'di dag bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen po de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du bdag nyid byin gyis brlabs nas sngags kyi tshig 'di dag bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Great Lord of the Vajra Yoginīs, having blessed himself as all the Tathāgatas, spoke these mantra words:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness are:

original: nang gi lus dang / phyi'i lus dang / phyi nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nang gi lus dang / phyi'i lus dang / phyi nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
translated: Regarding the inner body, the outer body, and the inner and outer body, one observes the body with diligence, possessing alertness,

original: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid me bde ba rnam par bsal cing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid me bde ba rnam par bsal cing rnam par spyod do //
translated: and with mindfulness, one practices, having eliminated worldly attachment and mental dissatisfaction.

original: lus la kun 'byung ba'i rje su lta zhing rnam @105a *//
analyzed: lus la kun 'byung ba'i rje su lta zhing rnam @105a *//
translated: One observes the arising of the body,

original: par spyod do //
analyzed: par spyod do //
translated: and practices.

original: lus la zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: lus la zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
translated: He practices observing the exhaustion of the body.

original: lus la mi gnas pa'i rnam par spyod cing 'jig rten du gang yang nye bar len pa med do //
analyzed: lus la mi gnas pa'i rnam par spyod cing 'jig rten du gang yang nye bar len pa med do //
translated: He practices without abiding in the body, and does not take up anything in the world.

original: nang gi tshor ba dang / phyi'i tshor ba dang / phyi nang gi tshor ba dang / nang gi sems dang / phyi'i sems dang / phyi nang gi sems dang / nang gi chos dang / phyi'i chos dang / phyi nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nang gi tshor ba dang / phyi'i tshor ba dang / phyi nang gi tshor ba dang / nang gi sems dang / phyi'i sems dang / phyi nang gi sems dang / nang gi chos dang / phyi'i chos dang / phyi nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
translated: He practices observing the internal feelings, the external feelings, and the internal and external feelings; the internal mind, the external mind, and the internal and external mind; the internal phenomena, the external phenomena, and the internal and external phenomena. He is diligent, mindful, and aware,

original: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal cing rnam par spyod do //🔽chos la kun 'byung ba'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal cing rnam par spyod do // chos la kun 'byung ba'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
translated: and he practices while dispelling worldly attachment and mental dissatisfaction.🔽He practices observing the arising of phenomena.

original: chos la zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: chos la zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
translated: He practices observing the exhaustion of phenomena.

original: chos la mi gnas pa'i rnam par spyod cing 'jig rten du gang yang nye bar len pa med do //
analyzed: chos la mi gnas pa'i rnam par spyod cing 'jig rten du gang yang nye bar len pa med do //
translated: He does not take up anything in the world, and yet he does not cease to act.

original: rtag tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lus dang / ngag dang / sems dang / chos mnyam pa nyid kyis gnas so //
analyzed: rtag tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lus dang / ngag dang / sems dang / chos mnyam pa nyid kyis gnas so //
translated: He always abides in the perfection of wisdom, by the sameness of body, speech, mind, and phenomena.

original: aom k'am aom tsa tv'a ri smri tyu pa pasth'a na na h'um/
analyzed: aom k'am aom tsa tv'a ri smri tyu pa pasth'a na na h'um/
translated: Oṃ kāṃ oṃ catur-smṛtyupasthāna-nāṃ hūṃ.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni /
translated: The four right efforts are:

original: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos ma skye pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'dun pa bskyed cing rtsol lo //
analyzed: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos ma skye pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'dun pa bskyed cing rtsol lo //
translated: For the non-arising of non-virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen, one generates aspiration and makes effort by way of non-apprehension.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: One makes effort in striving.

original: sems kyi mthu bskyed do //
analyzed: sems kyi mthu bskyed do //
translated: One generates the power of mind.

original: smon lam yang dag par 'debs so //
analyzed: smon lam yang dag par 'debs so //
translated: One makes prayers.🔽For the abandonment of non-virtuous dharmas that have arisen, one generates aspiration and so forth.

original: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa la sogs @105b pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do //
analyzed: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa la sogs @105b pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do //
translated: For the arising of virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen, one generates aspiration.

original: 'bad do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: 'bad do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: One makes effort.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin to //
translated: One holds the mind.

original: smon lam yang dag par 'debs so //
analyzed: smon lam yang dag par 'debs so //
translated: And he makes the right aspiration.

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams 'phel zhing shin tu rgyas par bya ba dang / sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams 'phel zhing shin tu rgyas par bya ba dang / sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do //
translated: He generates will for the increase and expansion of the wholesome states that have arisen, and for the completion of the meditation.

original: 'bad do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //🔽sems rab tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'bad do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo // sems rab tu 'dzin to //
translated: He makes effort, he exerts his mind, he makes his mind strenuous.

original: smon lam yang dag par 'debs so //
analyzed: smon lam yang dag par 'debs so //
translated: He holds his mind in check and he makes the right aspiration.

original: chos thams cad don dam par tshad med par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen pos 'di bka' stsal to //
analyzed: chos thams cad don dam par tshad med par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen pos 'di bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One, the Great Lord of Vajra Yoga, has spoken this for the realization of all phenomena as ultimately immeasurable.

original: aom samyaka pra h'a na sarbba ta th'a ga ta sa ma ta aa dhishthi te aa:ra:h'um/
analyzed: aom samyaka pra h'a na sarbba ta th'a ga ta sa ma ta aa dhishthi te aa:ra:h'um/
translated: Oṃ, may the perfect abandonment be accomplished by the blessing of all the Tathāgatas!

original: yang dag par spong ba brjod pa zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba brjod pa zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo'o //
translated: This is called the expression of the perfect abandonments, the gateway to the perfection of wisdom.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four bases of supernatural powers are:

original: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba sgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba sgom par bya'o //
translated: The base of supernatural power endowed with the concentration of aspiration and the factors of abandonment should be cultivated.

original: sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom par byed do //
analyzed: sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom par byed do //
translated: the concentration of mind, the concentration of diligence, and the concentration of investigation, and he cultivates the bases of supernatural power that are conjoined with the volitions for the relinquishment of the hindrances.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi sgo'i chos thams cad sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi sgo'i chos thams cad sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the characteristic of illusion of all phenomena through the doors of the ultimate and the conventional.

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyi 'khor los bsgyur bas bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyi 'khor los bsgyur bas bka' stsal to //
translated: Thus has it been said by the Blessed One, the Universal Monarch of all phenomena.

original: aom ri dhi p'a da p'a ra mi te la ba pa ra h'um h'um/
analyzed: aom ri dhi p'a da p'a ra mi te la ba pa ra h'um h'um/
translated: Oṃ rīdhipāda-pāramitā labha-pāraṃ hūṃ hūṃ.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i @106a *//
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i @106a *//
translated: The perfection of the bases of supernatural power

original: pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: is called the wisdom of equality.

original: dbang po lnga ni //
analyzed: dbang po lnga ni //
translated: The five faculties are

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: the faculty of faith, the faculty of diligence, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la dbang sgyur bas spros pa med pa'i dbang po 'di dag bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la dbang sgyur bas spros pa med pa'i dbang po 'di dag bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One, who has mastery over the equality of all phenomena, has taught these sense faculties free from conceptual elaboration.

original: aom aindri y'a ba bo dha pra dznye ai shenydza n'a ma n+ya n'a ya ga ta ya a'a:h'um/
analyzed: aom aindri y'a ba bo dha pra dznye ai shenydza n'a ma n+ya n'a ya ga ta ya a'a:h'um/
translated: Oṃ indriyāva bodhaprajñā iṣeñjanāmanyanāgatāya āḥ hūṃ.

original: dbang po mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The equality of the sense faculties is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: stobs lnga ni /
analyzed: stobs lnga ni /
translated: The five powers are:

original: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stebs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs so //
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stebs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs so //
translated: the power of faith, the power of diligence, the power of mindfulness, the power of concentration, and the power of wisdom.

original: zhes bka' stsal to; ;bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa /
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal to; ;bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa /
translated: The Blessed One, who abides in the equality of all phenomena,

original: stobs thams cad rtogs pa /
analyzed: stobs thams cad rtogs pa /
translated: who has realized all powers,

original: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: who is free from all conceptual elaboration,

original: gdod ma nas dag pas 'di bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gdod ma nas dag pas 'di bka' stsal pa /
translated: who is primordially pure, has taught this:

original: aom sarbba ta th'a ga t'a ba la aa:h'um h'um ba:/
analyzed: aom sarbba ta th'a ga t'a ba la aa:h'um h'um ba:/
translated: Oṃ sarvatathāgatābala āḥ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: stobs 'phel ba zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: stobs 'phel ba zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is called “increasing strength.”

original: changs pa'i gnas pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: changs pa'i gnas pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four divine abodes are

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms pa'o //
translated: loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: aom brahma bi h'a r'a dhishth'a na kam mam dru ksham h'um trum/
analyzed: aom brahma bi h'a r'a dhishth'a na kam mam dru ksham h'um trum/
translated: Oṃ brahma-vihārādhiṣṭhāna-kamamātrūṃ kṣaṃ hūṃ truṃ

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid ces pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @106b 'di bka' stsal to //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid ces pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @106b 'di bka' stsal to //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is called “the equality of all phenomena.”

original: tshangs pa'i gnas pa byin gyis rlob pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas pa byin gyis rlob pa'o //
translated: It is the consecration of the divine abodes.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four correct knowledges are

original: spobs pa so sor yang dag par rig pa dang / ngas pa'i tshigs so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa so sor yang dag par rig pa dang / ngas pa'i tshigs so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: the correct knowledge of eloquence, the correct knowledge of the words of the Vedas, the correct knowledge of meaning, and the correct knowledge of the Dharma.

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid du so so yang dag par rig pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid du so so yang dag par rig pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “The perfection of wisdom is the correct knowledge of all phenomena as having the characteristic of illusion.”

original: zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: Thus did he declare.

original: aom pra ti sambi da:svah'um/
analyzed: aom pra ti sambi da:svah'um/
translated: Oṃ pratisaṃvid svāhā.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The equality of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rjes su dran pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dran pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six recollections?

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / chos thams cad gcig tu rjes su dran pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / chos thams cad gcig tu rjes su dran pa ni /
translated: The recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dharma, the recollection of the Saṅgha, the recollection of giving, the recollection of morality, the recollection of the gods, and the recollection of all dharmas as one—

original: chos thams cad don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: all dharmas are said to be ultimately empty.

original: mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid med pa rnam par dpyod pas mnyam pa nyid kyi sgo zhes bya ba 'di ting nge 'dzin la dbang sgyur bas bka' stsal to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid med pa rnam par dpyod pas mnyam pa nyid kyi sgo zhes bya ba 'di ting nge 'dzin la dbang sgyur bas bka' stsal to //
translated: This is called the gate of equality that analyzes characteristics and the absence of characteristics. It was declared by the one who has mastery over samādhi.

original: aom sarba aa nu smri ti buddham sam pa d'a di shi h'um h'um h'um/
analyzed: aom sarba aa nu smri ti buddham sam pa d'a di shi h'um h'um h'um/
translated: Oṃ sarvānusmṛti buddhaṃ saṃpradīśaya hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ.

original: rjes su dran pa drug gi shes rab bo //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa drug gi shes rab bo //
translated: The wisdom of the six recollections.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven factors of awakening?🔽The factor of complete awakening that is right mindfulness,

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag @107a *//
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag @107a *//
translated: the factor of complete awakening that is the investigation of phenomena,🔽the factor of complete awakening that is right effort,🔽the factor of complete awakening that is right joy,🔽the factor of complete awakening that is right pliancy,

original: dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: the factor of complete awakening that is right concentration,

original: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
translated: and the factor of complete awakening that is right equanimity.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag mnyam pa nyid skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bka' stsal to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag mnyam pa nyid skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bka' stsal to //
translated: The perfection of wisdom called “The Characteristics of the Non-arising of the Equality of the Factors of Awakening.”

original: aom sarba t'a bo dhyam ga sa ma t'a su pra tishthi te dhum bam/
analyzed: aom sarba t'a bo dhyam ga sa ma t'a su pra tishthi te dhum bam/
translated: Oṃ sarva-bodhyaṅga-samatā-supratiṣṭhite dhuṃ bham

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom called “The Seven Factors of Awakening.”

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the noble eightfold path?

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: It is right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: right concentration.

original: lam zad mi shes pa'i byang chub kyi sems chen po la 'jug pa legs par so sor rig pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: lam zad mi shes pa'i byang chub kyi sems chen po la 'jug pa legs par so sor rig pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The path is the great, inexhaustible, engaging thought of enlightenment, the knowledge of all knowledge.

original: aom a'a rya sht'im ga marga m'a ta /
analyzed: aom a'a rya sht'im ga marga m'a ta /
translated: Om Arya-shantimarga-mat.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa nyid ces bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa nyid ces bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The noble eightfold path is the perfection of wisdom.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum ni /
translated: The three concentrations are

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //
translated: emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de la stong pa nyid @107b kyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid @107b kyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the concentration on emptiness?

original: stong pa'i rnam pa dang / dben pa'i rnam pa dang / med pa'i rnam pa dang / rang bzhin med pa'i rnam pa thams cad mtshan nyid gcig tu rtogs pa sems rtsi gcig pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa'i rnam pa dang / dben pa'i rnam pa dang / med pa'i rnam pa dang / rang bzhin med pa'i rnam pa thams cad mtshan nyid gcig tu rtogs pa sems rtsi gcig pa ste /
translated: the aspect of emptiness, the aspect of isolation, the aspect of non-existence, and the aspect of the absence of intrinsic nature, are all realized to be of one characteristic.

original: 'di ni / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ces brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ces brjod do //
translated: This is called the meditative absorption of emptiness.

original: de la mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the meditative absorption of signlessness?”

original: gang la mtshan mar ma byed pa dang / 'dod pa med pa dang / shes pa med pa dang / zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / rnam par bral ba'i rnam pa sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: gang la mtshan mar ma byed pa dang / 'dod pa med pa dang / shes pa med pa dang / zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / rnam par bral ba'i rnam pa sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: It is the one-pointed mind that does not form signs, does not desire, does not cognize, has the aspect of peace, and has the aspect of separation.

original: 'di ni / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the meditative absorption of signlessness.

original: de la smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the meditative absorption of wishlessness?”

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: It is the one-pointed mind that has the aspect of impermanence and the aspect of suffering.

original: de ni / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the meditative absorption of wishlessness.

original: chos thams cad rtogs nas smon par mi byed de /
analyzed: chos thams cad rtogs nas smon par mi byed de /
translated: Having understood all phenomena, he does not wish for anything.

original: lha 'am lha las gzhan gang yang rung ba don du mi gnyer zhing gsol ba 'debs par yang mi 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: lha 'am lha las gzhan gang yang rung ba don du mi gnyer zhing gsol ba 'debs par yang mi 'dod pa ste /
translated: He does not seek or request anything from any god or anyone else.

original: dngos po thams cad la ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi sgo yis kyang ngo //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad la ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi sgo yis kyang ngo //
translated: He has the door to all meditative absorptions with regard to all things.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo gsum nye bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo gsum nye bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: He realizes the three doors of meditative absorption through this perfection of wisdom alone.

original: aom kha sa ma:sarba dharm'a:kham/
analyzed: aom kha sa ma:sarba dharm'a:kham/
translated: Oṃ khaṃ samaḥ sarvadharmāḥ khaṃ.

original: de la stobs bcu ni /
analyzed: de la stobs bcu ni /
translated: The ten powers are as follows:

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang @108a *//
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang @108a *//
translated: The power of knowing what is the case and what is not the case, the power of knowing the fully ripened effects of actions, the power of knowing the various dhātus, the power of knowing the higher and lower capacities of beings,

original: mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa so sor mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mnges par shes pa lnga mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa so sor mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mnges par shes pa lnga mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowing former existences,🔽the power of knowing death and rebirth,

original: zag ba zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: zag ba zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: and the power of knowing the cessation of the outflows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid so sor rtogs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid so sor rtogs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the realization of the sameness of all tathāgatas.

original: aom da sha ba la sa ma t'a tha /
analyzed: aom da sha ba la sa ma t'a tha /
translated: Oṃ daśa-bala-samatā-tathā!

original: stobs bcu mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is called the sameness of the ten powers.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad gang zhe na /🔽gzugs can gyi gzugs rnams mthong ba 'di ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad gang zhe na / gzugs can gyi gzugs rnams mthong ba 'di ni /
translated: “What are the eight liberations?

original: rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The first liberation is when one with form sees forms.

original: nang gzugs med pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams mthong ba 'di ni /
analyzed: nang gzugs med pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams mthong ba 'di ni /
translated: The second liberation is when one who is inwardly formless perceives forms.

original: rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //🔽bzang bar mos pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o // bzang bar mos pa 'di ni /
translated: This is the second liberation.

original: rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //🔽gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o // gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
translated: The third liberation is the perception of beauty.🔽The fourth liberation is the complete transcendence of perceptions of form, the disappearance of perceptions of obstruction, and not attending to perceptions of multiplicity, thinking, ‘Infinite space is infinite.’

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so //
translated: The fifth liberation is the complete transcendence of the station of the infinity of space, thinking, ‘Consciousness is infinite.’🔽The sixth liberation is the complete transcendence of the station of the infinity of consciousness, thinking, ‘There is nothing at all.’🔽The seventh liberation is the complete transcendence of the station of nothing whatsoever, entering and remaining in the station of neither perception nor nonperception.

original: zhes te nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrub te gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: zhes te nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrub te gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: The eighth liberation is the complete transcendence of the station of neither perception nor nonperception, entering and remaining in the cessation of perception and sensation.

original: rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: These are the eight liberations.🔽“What are the nine serial steps of meditative absorption?

original: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das ta rnam par @108b shes pa mtha' yas so //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das ta rnam par @108b shes pa mtha' yas so //
translated: The first serial step of meditative absorption is the complete transcendence of perceptions of form, the disappearance of perceptions of obstruction, and not attending to perceptions of multiplicity, thinking, ‘Space is infinite.’

original: zhes rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /🔽rnam bar thar pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: zhes rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni / rnam bar thar pa lnga pa'o //
translated: The second serial step of meditative absorption is the complete transcendence of the station of the infinity of space, thinking, ‘Consciousness is infinite.’

original: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te cung zad ma yod do //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te cung zad ma yod do //
translated: The third serial step of meditative absorption is the complete transcendence of the station of the infinity of consciousness, thinking, ‘There is nothing at all.’🔽The fourth serial step of meditative absorption is the complete transcendence of the station of nothing whatsoever, entering and remaining in the station of neither perception nor nonperception.

original: zhes cung zad med pa'i skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: zhes cung zad med pa'i skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: Having accomplished the sphere of nothingness, one abides in it.🔽

original: rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth liberation.🔽Having completely transcended the sphere of infinite space,🔽abiding in the sphere of infinite consciousness,

original: rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes med 'du shes med man skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes med 'du shes med man skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: thinking ‘Consciousness is infinite,’

original: rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o //
translated: this is the seventh liberation.🔽Having completely transcended the sphere of infinite consciousness,🔽abiding in the sphere of nothing-at-all,

original: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: thinking ‘There is nothing at all,’

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: this is the eighth liberation.

original: chos thams cad spros pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing rnam par byang ba med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad spros pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing rnam par byang ba med pa /
translated: The characteristic of all phenomena is free from elaborations, free from afflictions, and free from purification.

original: bsam gtan med cing bsam gtan med pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan med cing bsam gtan med pa ma yin pa /
translated: They are not meditative concentration, nor are they not meditative concentration.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa med cing snyoms par 'jug pa med pa ma yin pa 'di bka' stsal to //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa med cing snyoms par 'jug pa med pa ma yin pa 'di bka' stsal to //
translated: He has declared the absence of meditative absorption and the absence of the absence of meditative absorption.

original: aom santa bha dre sarba sva bh'a wa bi shuddhe dham sham kham/
analyzed: aom santa bha dre sarba sva bh'a wa bi shuddhe dham sham kham/
translated: Oṃ santra bhadra sarva svabhāva viśuddhe dharme svāhā.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is called “free from what is possible and impossible.”

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four forms of fearlessness?

original: bdag gis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bdag gis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: I have fully awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: zhes dam bcas na /🔽chos 'di rnams @109a *//
analyzed: zhes dam bcas na / chos 'di rnams @109a *//

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so //

analyzed: zhes bya bar bdag la dge sbyong ngam /

original: bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: bram ze'am / lha'am /

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /

analyzed: skye rgyu'i tshogs gzhan ci yang rung ste 'jig rten na chos dang ldan par rgol bar 'gyur ro //

original: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms su gnas @110a *//🔽te dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can bde ba lus kyis myong la /
analyzed: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms su gnas @110a *// te dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can bde ba lus kyis myong la /
translated: He achieves and remains in the second concentration, which is without conceptualization and analysis and is born of samādhi, and which is filled with the joy and pleasure born of samādhi.🔽“He is free from desire and is equanimous, mindful, and discerning.🔽He experiences pleasure with his body and remains in this way.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis de la dran pa dang ldan pa'i bde ba la rnam par spyod pa btang snyoms ba'o; ;zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis de la dran pa dang ldan pa'i bde ba la rnam par spyod pa btang snyoms ba'o; ;zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: The noble ones describe this as ‘he abides in mindfulness and experiences pleasure with his body.’

original: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He achieves and remains in the third concentration, which is without joy.

original: de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba yang med /
analyzed: de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba yang med /
translated: “He abandons pleasure, abandons pain, and having previously abandoned mental pleasure and pain, he achieves and remains in the fourth concentration, which is without pleasure or pain and is purified in terms of equanimity and mindfulness.”

original: sdug bsngal ba yang med /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang med /
translated: He is not happy.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang med /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang med /
translated: He is not unhappy.

original: btang snyoms pa dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: btang snyoms pa dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He is equanimous, mindful, and lives happily.

original: de rnams pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
analyzed: de rnams pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
translated: He completely transcends the perceptions of form and the perceptions of obstruction come to an end.

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so //
translated: He does not pay attention to the perception of variety.

original: zhes te nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar grubs te gnas so //
analyzed: zhes te nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar grubs te gnas so //
translated: He thinks, ‘Space is infinite,’ and he achieves and remains in the sphere of infinite space.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te dam par shes pa mtha' yas so //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te dam par shes pa mtha' yas so //
translated: He completely transcends the sphere of infinite space and thinks, ‘Consciousness is infinite.’

original: zhes rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: zhes rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He achieves and remains in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te cung zad ma yod do //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te cung zad ma yod do //
translated: He completely transcends the sphere of infinite consciousness and thinks, ‘There is nothing at all.’

original: zhes cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽de rnam pa @110b thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: zhes cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // de rnam pa @110b thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having accomplished the sphere of nothingness.🔽He completely transcends the sphere of nothingness and dwells having accomplished the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de rnam pa thams cad 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He completely transcends the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception and dwells having accomplished the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad po dang mnyam pa nyid rjes su thob nas dngos por rtog par mi byed //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad po dang mnyam pa nyid rjes su thob nas dngos por rtog par mi byed //
translated: Having attained the equality of the eight liberations, he does not conceptualize entities.

original: dngos po med par rtogs pa mi byed /
analyzed: dngos po med par rtogs pa mi byed /
translated: He does not conceptualize non-entities.

original: chos thams cad gnyis su med par rtogs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad gnyis su med par rtogs so //
translated: He realizes all phenomena as non-dual.

original: 'di ni / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: This is the equality of the nine successive absorptions.

original: aom aa nanta: bi mo kshu mu she shum/
analyzed: aom aa nanta: bi mo kshu mu she shum/
translated: Oṃ ananta, vimokṣa, muṣe śa

original: dngos po thams cad mthar gyis gnas pa'i rnam par thar pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o; ;de la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad mthar gyis gnas pa'i rnam par thar pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o; ;de la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: “What are the ten perfections?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: They are the perfection of generosity, the perfection of good conduct, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of meditation, the perfection of wisdom,

original: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of aspiration, the perfection of knowledge, the perfection of power, the perfection of means, the perfection of all, the perfection of the equal of the unequaled,

original: spros pa med @111a *//
analyzed: spros pa med @111a *//
translated: and the perfection of nonelaboration.

original: pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / yang dag pa'i don gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi don gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rdo rje'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rin po che'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / yang dag pa'i don gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi don gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rdo rje'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rin po che'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of the essence of the Dharma, the perfection of the meaning of the essence of all phenomena, the vajra perfection, the jewel perfection,

original: padma'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / las kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste; bstan pa'i rjes su rtogs pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: padma'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / las kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste; bstan pa'i rjes su rtogs pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: the lotus perfection, the karma perfection, and the perfection of the equality of all phenomena.

original: aom sarba p'a ra mi ta aartha pa ri p'u ra ni /
analyzed: aom sarba p'a ra mi ta aartha pa ri p'u ra ni /
translated: Oṃ sarva pāramitā artha paripūraṇi

original: aom bram h'um tam/
analyzed: aom bram h'um tam/
translated: Oṃ brahmā hūṃ taṃ🔽The perfection of all is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o; ;de las bcu pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o; ;de las bcu pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the tenth?

original: rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i sa dang / dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i sa dang / 'od byed pa zhes bya ba dang / 'od 'phro ba zhes bya ba dang / sbyang dka' ba zhes bya ba dang / mngon du gyur pa zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i sa dang / dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i sa dang / 'od byed pa zhes bya ba dang / 'od 'phro ba zhes bya ba dang / sbyang dka' ba zhes bya ba dang / mngon du gyur pa zhes bya ba dang /
translated: The Manifest One,🔽The Gone Afar,🔽The Immovable,🔽The One of Brilliant Intelligence,🔽The Cloud of Dharma,

original: ring du song ba zhes bya ba dang / mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya ba dang / chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba dang / sa thams cad don gcig ste /
analyzed: ring du song ba zhes bya ba dang / mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya ba dang / chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba dang / sa thams cad don gcig ste /
translated: and all the stages have the same meaning.

original: 'di ltar ye shes kyi don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar ye shes kyi don to //
translated: In this way, the meaning is that of pristine consciousness.

original: ye shes kyang ci yang med pa /
analyzed: ye shes kyang ci yang med pa /
translated: Pristine consciousness is also nothing whatsoever.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa /
translated: It is free from afflictions.

original: yi ge med pa /
analyzed: yi ge med pa /
translated: It is without syllables.

original: don yod pa /
analyzed: don yod pa /
translated: It is meaningful.

original: gdong ma nas dag pa /
analyzed: gdong ma nas dag pa /
translated: It is pure from the beginning.

original: dri ma med pa /
analyzed: dri ma med pa /
translated: It is stainless.

original: 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba /
translated: It is clear light.

original: brjod pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said to be free from expression.

original: aom bhu mi bi sho dha ni sarb'a rtha ba ri p'u ra ni bam bhum/
analyzed: aom bhu mi bi sho dha ni sarb'a rtha ba ri p'u ra ni bam bhum/
translated: Oṃ bhūmi viśodhani sarva-artha-pari-pūraṇi vaṃ bhūm

original: sa yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha @111b rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sa yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha @111b rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom called “purifying the stages. ”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten bodhisattva stages?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa dang / gzhon nur gyur pa dang / las dang po pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa dang / skye ba nas skye bar sbyor ba dang ldan pa dang / bsam pa dang ldan pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa dang / gzhon nur gyur pa dang / las dang po pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa dang / skye ba nas skye bar sbyor ba dang ldan pa dang / bsam pa dang ldan pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattvas are the newly initiated, the youthful, the beginners, the practitioners, those who are engaged in the process of rebirth, those who have the intention, those who are irreversible,

original: dbang bskur ba thob pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa dor ba ste /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba thob pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa dor ba ste /
translated: those who have attained consecration, those who are impeded by a single birth, and the bodhisattvas who are in their final state.

original: don dam par gnas pa gcig yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don dam par gnas pa gcig yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are all one in the ultimate sense,

original: 'di ltar gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: because they are all without abiding.🔽Oṃ sarva-vyathāna-vigate hūṃ

original: aom sarba bhya basth'a na bi ga te h'um; rnam par gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: aom sarba bhya basth'a na bi ga te h'um; rnam par gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom called “without abiding. ”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten masteries of the bodhisattvas?

original: tshe la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: tshe la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang ba dang /
translated: They are mastery over life, mastery over action, mastery over requisites, mastery over devotion, mastery over prayer, mastery over transformation, mastery over intuition, mastery over Dharma,

original: sems la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: sems la dbang ba'o //
translated: and mastery over the mind.

original: dbang ba dang mi dbang ba rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba thams cad la dbang ba /
analyzed: dbang ba dang mi dbang ba rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba thams cad la dbang ba /
translated: Mastery is the power to manifest anything desired, and nonmastery is the opposite.

original: dbang phyug thams cad la dbang rjes su thob pa /
analyzed: dbang phyug thams cad la dbang rjes su thob pa /
translated: The bodhisattva has attained mastery over all things, and has attained mastery over all powers.

original: chos thams cad dang legs par rab tu ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad dang legs par rab tu ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is endowed with all the Dharmas.

original: aom sarba ba shi te trem hrum h'um/
analyzed: aom sarba ba shi te trem hrum h'um/
translated: Om sarva-vasitva-trem hum.

original: thams cad la dbang ba zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad la dbang ba zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Mastery over all is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa @112a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa @112a *//
translated: The Tathagata

original: la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o //
translated: has no error.

original: ca co mi mnga'o //🔽dgongs pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ca co mi mnga'o // dgongs pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not speak incoherently.🔽He does not have a lapse of recollection.

original: thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have a lack of meditative equipoise.

original: 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga'o //🔽ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //
analyzed: 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga'o // ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have various kinds of perceptions.🔽He does not have an indifference that is not based on discernment.

original: mos pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: mos pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have a lapse of aspiration.

original: brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //🔽dgongs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o // dgongs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have a lapse of effort.🔽He does not have a lapse of recollection.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have a lapse of meditative stabilization.

original: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have a lapse of wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have a lapse of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //🔽'das pa'i dus la ma thogs ma chags pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go /🔽ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o // 'das pa'i dus la ma thogs ma chags pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go /
translated: He does not have a lapse of the vision of liberated wisdom.🔽His wisdom vision engages the past without obstruction or attachment.🔽His wisdom vision engages the future without obstruction or attachment.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go /
translated: His wisdom vision engages the present without obstruction or attachment.

original: sku'i 'phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: sku'i 'phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: All the activities of his body are preceded by gnosis;

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: they follow after gnosis.

original: gsung gi 'phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: gsung gi 'phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: All the activities of his speech are preceded by gnosis;

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: they follow after gnosis.🔽All the activities of his mind are preceded by gnosis;

original: thugs kyi 'phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: thugs kyi 'phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: they follow after gnosis.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni /
translated: All the tathāgatas

original: yul thams cad du dus thams cad kyi tshe thams cad mnyam pa nyid la legs par rab tu gnas @112b pa ste /
analyzed: yul thams cad du dus thams cad kyi tshe thams cad mnyam pa nyid la legs par rab tu gnas @112b pa ste /
translated: are well and truly established in the sameness of all objects at all times.

original: stong pa nyid la yang dag par rjes su rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la yang dag par rjes su rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Because they have realized emptiness,

original: shes rab yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: they have completely pure wisdom.

original: aom aa we ni ka buddha dharma sa ma te aa: b'i ra h'um kham/
analyzed: aom aa we ni ka buddha dharma sa ma te aa: b'i ra h'um kham/
translated: Oṃ avaṇika buddha dharma samate aḥ vi ra hūṃ khaṃ

original: ma 'dres pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom called “the sameness of the unmixed.

original: de la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams ci zhe na /
analyzed: de la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams ci zhe na /
translated: What are the thirty-two marks of a great person?

original: phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'khor los mtshan pa nyid de /🔽'di yi phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil dag la 'khor lo rtsibs stong can lte ba dang bcas pa /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'khor los mtshan pa nyid de / 'di yi phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil dag la 'khor lo rtsibs stong can lte ba dang bcas pa /
translated: The soles of the feet and hands are marked with a wheel.

original: mu khyud dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: mu khyud dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: On the soles of his feet and hands there is a wheel with a thousand spokes, a hub, and a circumference, complete in every respect.

original: phyag dang zhabs gyi mthil legs par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs gyi mthil legs par gnas pa ste /
translated: The feet and hands are well-placed.

original: zhabs kyi mthil thams cad kyis sa gzhi la reg cing de yang 'di'i mtho ba ni /🔽dma' ba dang / dma' ba ni /
analyzed: zhabs kyi mthil thams cad kyis sa gzhi la reg cing de yang 'di'i mtho ba ni / dma' ba dang / dma' ba ni /
translated: The entire soles of the feet touch the ground, and the feet are not bent.🔽The lower part of the legs is like that of an antelope.

original: mtho ba'o // phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo dang pa'i rgyal po lta bu dra bas 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: mtho ba'o // phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo dang pa'i rgyal po lta bu dra bas 'brel pa ste /
translated: The fingers and toes are joined by webs, like the king of birds.
